newsitem.title: USA: Compass Group unit closes DAKA tender.
newsitem.headline: Compass Group unit closes DAKA tender.

text.p: Compass Group PLC said Wednesday its subsidiary Compass Holdings Inc has completed its tender offer for DAKA International's contract foodservice business.
It said 10.6 million common shares of DAKA were tendered at a price of $7.50 in cash, representing about 95 percent of DAKA's outstanding common stock.
Prior to the completion of the tender offer, DAKA distributed one common share of a new corporation, Unique Casual Restaurants Inc, for each DAKA share then outstanding.
Unique has been approved for listing on the Nasdaq national market under the symbol UNIQ, Compass said.
Compass Holdings said it plans to initiate a short form merger to acquire all of the remaining shares of DAKA. The shares will be converted into the right to receive $7.50 per share in cash.
The short form merger is expected to take plan on July 18, it said.
Through a subsidiary, DAKA's contract foodservice business operates about 310 contracts in 710 locations in 34 states across the U.S. and employs about 9,700 people.
Compass Group, incorporated in England and Wales, is one of the world's largest foodservice companies and employs over 130,000 people worldwide.
